[TITLE]
<line: 23> SECOND DENIAL OF ENTRY OF DEFAULT  

[TEXT]
<line: 25> Pending is Plaintiffs’ Motion for Entry of Default against Defendant (Docket Entry No. 29).  
<line: 26> The motion is denied as Plaintiffs still have not provided an affidavit of military service as required 
<line: 27> by the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act of 2003 (50 App. U.S.C. 501 et seq.), despite having been 
<line: 28> instructed to do so in the Clerk’s first denial of default (Docket Entry No. 26).  Should Plaintiffs wish 
<line: 29> to file an additional motion which includes the required affidavit of military service, they are advised 
<line: 30> it is not necessary to attach as support documents such as the Complaint, which are already filed in 
<line: 31> the case and available on the record.  It is sufficient to refer to those documents and provide docket 
<line: 32> and page numbers for the referenced information.   

[ABANDON]
<line: 34> s/ Keith Throckmorton 
<line: 35> Keith Throckmorton 
<line: 36> Clerk of Court 

[ABANDON]
